settings.name: Day or night selection
settings.description: Select if you want to extract night roosts or day resting/feeding sites or (by default) all rest sites during a 24h period (defined as midnight to 23:59).

options.displayText: From sunset to sunrise (night). Timing can be adapted below.
From sunrise to sunset (day). Timing can be adapted below.

settings.name: Sunrise adaption time
settings.description: Select how many minutes after (negative numbers if before) sunrise your animals start resting.

settings.name: Sunset adaption time
settings.description: Select how many minutes after (negative numbers if before) sunset your animals start resting.

settings.name: Speed variable name
settings.description: Name of variable in your data set that indicates speed measured at each location to use for filtering for ground locations. Use GPS ground speed for best results. By default, movement speed as interpolated from subsequent locations in the data ('move::speed()') will be used.

settings.name: Maximum resting speed
settings.description: Insert maximum resting speed of your animal(s) (in m/s), i.e. at which speed do you still consider it 'resting'. All locations with speed above this value will be removed. Defaults to 1 m/s

settings.name: Minimum resting duration
settings.description: Insert minimum duration (in hours) that your animal(s) must remain within a particular area to be considered resting. If resting radius is given (see below), use 1 hour here as default.

settings.name: Maximum resting radius
settings.description: Insert maximum radius (in m) within which your animal(s) must remain to be considered resting. Locations can be affected by location inaccuracy (e.g. GPS error) or by movements of the animal itself. If a resting duration is given (see above), a default of 1,000 m (1 km) is used here.
